item.title: Mercurial and Git
item.description: Mercurial and Git are both used for version control. Both Mercurial (Hg) and Git are popular distributed version control systems (DVCS), but they have some key differences in their approach: Branching Model: Mercurial: Employs a centralized branching model, meaning each branch has its own separate directory.
